Autonomy and Tax
Exemptions in Regards to autonomy catalonia Received some in the late 70s and regarding Tax Exemptions now has Just Refused and those Tax Exemptions are
A huge issue because
catalonia Is one of The richest regions in spain and Pays far more in Taxes Than It receives and Benefits and Many of catalonia's Leaders
Have Called This relationship Unequal so due to the differences between spain and catalonia Groups and catalonia
Have Now Been Calling for referendums on independence This isn't a new Thing
Catalonia Has had a Handful of these in the past Few Years most Recently on november 9th 2014 there Was an Unofficial
Non-Binding referendum on independence and There
80% voted for an independent Nation Lever it's Believed That Only Around 39 Percent of eligible Voters Actually went out
To vote to that Added a Cloud of This being an illegitimate
Vote so unsurprisingly
The Referendum Was Considered illegal By The spanish supreme court supreme court ruling That spanish National Integrity Could Not Be infringed also ruling The cattle
Was Not a sovereign Entity That They don't
Have the right to decide These Kinds of Things and We Also Saw three prominent politicians Who were behind the vote Banned from public office
For Two Years Now despite all of This Barcelona has had Massive Rallies Every year pushing for independence still we were talking over a Million
People Showing Up in a Region of Around Seven million so then Let's Jump to
catalonia Holds regional Elections for Their parliament They Call It the Generally top and They're Seventy five Percent of eligible Voters Turned Out for the

Another Pro independence Party But It Was still an Unusual Pair it's because there's a Coalition Between a Far Left group and a Center-right Group

otherwise Known as dipping and so This meant a binding independence referendum Would be Held october 1sT 2017
